definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: I know of one victim of crime who testified against her attacker in court.
sentences.chinese: 我知道一位受害者，她在法庭上指证攻击她的人。

sentences.english: You don't have a reason for a cesarean in this pregnancy, such as a placenta previa.
sentences.chinese: 你这次怀孕没有必须剖腹产的指证，如胎盘前置。

sentences.english: The gardai have photos of these gangs and no witnesses identified them.
sentences.chinese: 警察局有这些家伙的相片但没有证据指证他们。

sentences.english: I don't think I've got the kind of super-X-ray economic vision to call that one right either.
sentences.chinese: 我也不自认有某种超级X射线般的经济视觉来指证它。

definition: to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
